00014 /* $Id: hbitio.h 4932 2007-09-07 17:17:23Z bmribler $ */
00015 
00016 /*
00017    **  hbitio.h
00018    **
00019    **  Data structures and macros for bitfile access to HDF data objects.
00020    **  These are mainly used for compression I/O and N-bit data objects.
00021  */
00022 
00023 #ifndef __HBITIO_H
00024 #define __HBITIO_H
00025 
00026 /* Define the number of elements in the buffered array */
00027 #define BITBUF_SIZE 4096
00028 /* Macro to define the number of bits cached in the 'bits' variable */
00029 #define BITNUM      (sizeof(uint8)*8)
00030 /* Macro to define the number of bits able to be read/written at a time */
00031 #define DATANUM     (sizeof(uint32)*8)
00032 
00033 typedef struct bitrec_t
00034   {
00035       int32       acc_id;       /* Access ID for H layer I/O routines */
00036       int32       bit_id;       /* Bitfile ID for internal use */
00037   /* Note that since HDF has signed 32bit offset limit we need to change this to signed
00038      since the get passed to Hxxx calls which take signed 32bit arguments */
00039       int32      block_offset, /* offset of the current buffered block in the dataset */
00040                  max_offset,   /* offset of the last byte written to the dataset */
00041                  byte_offset;  /* offset of the current byte in the dataset */
00042 
00043       intn       count,        /* bit count to next boundary */
00044                  buf_read;     /* number of bytes read into buffer (necessary for random I/O) */
00045       uint8       access;       /* What the access on this file is ('r', 'w', etc..) */
00046       uint8       mode;         /* how are we interacting with the data now ('r', 'w', etc) */
00047       uint8       bits;         /* extra bit buffer, 0..BITNUM-1 bits */
00048       uint8      *bytep;        /* current position in buffer */
00049       uint8      *bytez;        /* end of buffer to compare */
00050       uint8      *bytea;        /* byte buffer */
00051   }
00052 bitrec_t;
00053 
00054 #ifndef BITMASTER
00055 extern
00056 #endif
00057 const uint8 maskc[9]
00058 #ifdef BITMASTER
00059 =
00060 {0, 1, 3, 7, 15, 31, 63, 127, 255}
00061 #endif
00062            ;
00063 
00064 #ifndef BITMASTER
00065 extern
00066 #endif
00067 const uint32 maskl[33]
00068 #ifdef BITMASTER
00069 =
00070 {0x00000000,
00071  0x00000001, 0x00000003, 0x00000007, 0x0000000f,
00072  0x0000001f, 0x0000003f, 0x0000007f, 0x000000ff,
00073  0x000001ff, 0x000003ff, 0x000007ff, 0x00000fff,
00074  0x00001fff, 0x00003fff, 0x00007fff, 0x0000ffff,
00075  0x0001ffff, 0x0003ffff, 0x0007ffff, 0x000fffff,
00076  0x001fffff, 0x003fffff, 0x007fffff, 0x00ffffff,
00077  0x01ffffff, 0x03ffffff, 0x07ffffff, 0x0fffffff,
00078  0x1fffffff, 0x3fffffff, 0x7fffffff, 0xffffffffUL}
00079 #endif
00080            ;
00081 
00082 /* Function-like Macros */
00083 #define Hputbit(bitid,bit) ((Hbitwrite(bitid,1,(uint32)bit)==FAIL) ? FAIL : SUCCEED)
00084 
00085 #endif /* __HBITIO_H */
